IT Operations Analyst Intern


Värde Partners is a $14 billion global alternative investment firm that employs a value-based approach to investing across a broad array of geographies, segments and asset types, including corporate and traded credit, real estate, mortgages, financial services, real assets and infrastructure. The firm sponsors and manages a family of private investment funds with a global investor base that includes foundations and endowments, pension plans, insurance companies, other institutional investors and private clients. Now in its third decade, Värde employs more than 300 people globally with regional headquarters in New York, Minneapolis, London and Singapore.

Värde’s investing activities are guided by the following investment philosophy: (i) search opportunistically for undervalued or inefficient markets; (ii) invest in financial assets at a discount to their intrinsic value; (iii) identify catalysts for value recognition; (iv) pursue medium-term investment horizons; and (v) manage risk through diversified investment programs and trading strategies.

Our firm’s core values of Integrity, Excellence, Collegiality, Innovation and Humility are apparent in our workplace every day. Värde employees are rewarded for their contributions, especially their passion, expertise and ideas. For more information, please visit our website at www.varde.com. If you would like to be considered for employment with Värde Partners, please review our open roles on our careers page.

Summary of Responsibilities

  • Assist the Chief of Staff (Technology) in vendor management, data management and budgeting processes
  • Attend meetings and take notes/action items

  • Assist in migrating and linking documentation between Confluence and SharePoint

  • Gather evidence for control audit requests under guidance.

  • Currently pursuing a 4-year college degree in Information Systems, Engineering or Computer Science. A minor in general business or accounting is a plus but not required
  • Detail-oriented with strong analytical skills. Ability to think big picture while operating on detail-oriented tasks
  • Strong Excel skills. Experience with Tableau, PowerPoint or a coding language (Python, SQL, etc.) is a plus
  • Demonstrated ability to work on multiple tasks, conflicting priorities and able to prioritize appropriately
  • Personal characteristics of self-confidence, resourcefulness, self-motivation, discipline and the ability to work effectively with people in a remote working environment
  • Excellent written & verbal communication
  • The successful applicant for this position must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship

Titan America Mid-Atlantic
Roanoke, VA


Titan America LLC is a leading environmentally and socially progressive heavy building materials company located in the eastern United States. Titan America is part of the TITAN Group, an independent, multi-regional producer of cement and other related building materials. Our products include cement, aggregate, ready-mixed concrete and fly ash beneficiation. TITAN Group has a record of continuous growth since its establishment in 1902. **Note: Unfortunately, Summer Internships at LendingTree are not open to students who will require sponsorship now or at any point in the future. Thank you.

This position will likely work remotely the entire summer. However, our preference is to hire someone who will be based in the San Mateo, CA area on the chance we're able to go back to office during the summer.


THE POSITION

Our former Summer Interns will tell you, LendingTree’s Internship Program is selective, challenging and structured to push the limits of what they thought they could do - and they wouldn’t have wanted it any other way. Are there easier ways to spend your summer? Absolutely. But a LendingTree Internship will help you grow professionally and also get you closer to landing a phenomenal job once you graduate – maybe even with LendingTree. Here’s what you can expect:

  • Real work. The only person you’ll be getting coffee for at LendingTree is yourself. You’ll be doing professional level work that will have a real impact on the business
  • Training. Sure you’ll learn a ton of industry skills as you contribute to your team every day, but you’ll also go through specific training on: crafting a phenomenal resume and LinkedIn profile, getting interviews and how to handle them, how to give a great presentation and more
  • You’re not alone. In addition from the support from your team you’ll be assigned a Mentor outside of your department who will guide you and mentor you throughout the summer
  • End of summer presentation. At the end of the summer every Intern gives a PPT presentation to Executives which will include a summary of what you accomplished, what you learned and 2 ideas that will either make the company money or save the company money

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Own specific problem and experiment with solutions to benefit millions of users
  • Derive deep insights through user interviews and research in order to cultivate empathy
  • Lead collaboration across engineering, design, marketing, and the business
  • Scope, define, and refine actionable product requirements to test, measure, and learn
  • Monitor and analyze product performance, communicating findings and recommendations
  • Present product outcome achievement to the product team, organization, and leadership
  • Drive product growth efforts from ideation to delivery

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Undergrad or grad student (3.5+ GPA required) who will be graduating in Dec. 2021 or May 2022 (GPA must be listed on your resume to be considered)
  • Preferred majors: Management Information Systems, Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, Business, Data science/analytics
  • Proficient in Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs, etc.) and SQL
  • Good understanding of how APIs work; Comfortable communicating with technical terms
  • Knowledge of Agile/Scrum product development or software development methodologies is preferred
  • Passion in Mobile App and App-focused UX
  • Knowledge, experience or strong interest in Growth and Personal finance space
  • Willingness to roll up your sleeves and GET STUFF DONE.

COMPANY

LendingTree is the nation’s largest online lending marketplace. That means we connect customers with multiple lenders so they find the best deals on loans, credit cards, savings accounts and insurance. Our goal is to help people save money, and we believe the best way to do that is by giving them a way to shop for loans and compare lenders so they make their best financial choices. Our CEO Doug Lebda founded the company in 1996 after a frustrating house-hunting experience. In those days, we mostly helped people find good mortgage deals. Now, we help consumers find their best in personal loans, auto loans, business loans, student loans, credit cards, savings accounts, home equity loans and more.

What else you should know:

  • We’re a publicly-traded company (TREE).
  • We’ve welcomed several other companies into the LendingTree family to augment our efforts at helping borrowers make their most sensible financial choices.
  • We’ve built the LendingTree app and My LendingTree dashboard to give consumers tools to manage and monitor their financial health.
  • We still make funny commercials.

CULTURE

We’re a fast-paced company with an entrepreneurial bend. We work hard and test our products often. We’re collaborative, ambitious, candid and high-energy. Our teammates are some of the brightest, most talented people you’ll ever work with. We care more about your smarts than we do about the kinds of clothes you wear (but please, do wear clothes to work!), and we’re pretty good about rewarding innovation, creativity and the knack for just getting stuff done (we even have an award for employees called the GSD, “Get Stuff Done”).

Come work with us!

LendingTree is the kind of company that not only promotes diversity and inclusion; we thrive because of these values. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion (or creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation or military status.

Job Description

Seeq makes data analytics software for a big market that’s often overlooked by tech companies: industrial process data. Think pharmaceutical manufacturers, wind farms, and energy companies with tons of equipment and sensors. Our software engineers tackle hard problems in streaming calculation, storage and distributed computing, and we create elegant HTML5 data visualizations with smooth interactivity.

Our company is 100% remote and proud of it. You can work anywhere in the U.S. or Canada. We use a variety of collaboration tools, like Zoom, Slack, and our homegrown (and open-sourced) Qube Virtual Office, which makes us feel like we're in the same building together. We use agile tenets to iterate on both our product and development processes. We have a wonderful team of kind-hearted, talented engineers that love to collaborate, teach each other new tricks, and build products that exceed our customers’ expectations.

Our technology stack is largely JVM languages (Java, Kotlin) with some C#/.NET on the backend, and TypeScript / React (migrating from AngularJS) on the frontend. The core of our product is a full-featured calculation engine that can perform complex math and execute machine learning algorithms on streaming time series data.

Skills & Requirements

You love computers and programming. You’ve done projects at school or on your own that you’re very proud of. You may have contributed to an open source project.

You’re en route to a degree in Computer Science or related technical field.

If you work on the back-end, you want to learn to work with databases (Postgres, Cassandra), distributed computing (Spark, Kafka) and cloud platforms (EC2, Azure, GCE). If you work on the front-end, you want to build beautiful single-page applications (React, D3.js, and Bootstrap). You're interested in finding the best tool to solve a problem without getting caught up in whether it's the new hip thing.

You’re disciplined with a high attention to detail. You learn things quickly.

You listen really well, and you know how to make your ideas be heard without turning people off.

You want to work with a bunch of really smart people that love working together. And you want to work at a startup with lots of happy customers, good investors, and a bright future.

You’ve read this far and are determined to apply directly through seeq.com/careers and not through a third-party hiring site.

You will answer the following question in your application cover letter: “What makes you excited about Seeq?”

About Seeq Corporation

Seeq is a remote-only company founded by serial entrepreneurs. Our executive team and board of directors have extensive experience with successful startup ventures in high-growth environments.

We are founded on the idea that companies need better solutions for quickly and easily getting business insight from their industrial process data. Our mission is to provide software and services that convert that data into meaningful information that the business can use to improve profitability.

We use the best modern big data technologies to bring industrial process data into the business decision process.

Our company is virtual, meaning that everyone works from a location of their choosing. There’s no commute and no cubicle! We are serious about recruiting and retaining the best teammates. We think there are tons of benefits to working on exciting technology with a cohesive team and the flexibility to work from anywhere.

Seeq is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment, as Seeq does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation or any other classification protected by Federal, state, or local law.

Our Company

With all the expenditures made in analytics, it’s time to stop buying into partial solutions that overpromise and underdeliver. It’s time to invest in answers. Only Teradata leverages all of the data, all of the time, so customers can analyze anything, deploy anywhere, and deliver analytics that matter most to them . And we do it on-premises, in the Cloud, or anywhere in between, throughout the world. We call this pervasive data intelligence. It’s the new way we transform how businesses work and people live through the power of data.

Our summer internship program lasts 10-12 weeks beginning in May/June and ending in August/September. Fast-paced, flexible, fun. That describes our work environment at Teradata, a place to brainstorm with the best engineering minds and surprise yourself with what's possible every day.

Handling complex dependencies in software design, implementation, testing, documentation and support and maintenance activities as well as software packaging Build low friction APIs, highly responsive web UIs, and the backend to support them. Communicate effectively with other engineers and QA First-level test engineer with excellent analyst skills Use knowledge and experience to influence the design and implementation approaches and solutions

Pursuing a BS degree in Computer Science with 0-2 years of experience or pursuing a Master/PHd degree Strong computer science fundamentals in data structures, algorithm design, and complexity analysis A passion for cloud technology, API design, and responsive UX Demonstrated proficiency with at least one modern general-purpose programming languages like JavaScript, Java, C++, Go, Python, etc. Ability to build an end-to-end user experience as part of a service oriented product.

Preferred Qualifications
Java programming experience or course work Web-based development experience Familiarity with dev-ops software development methods. Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, testing, and operations. Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs. Experience with cloud services like AWS or Microsoft Azure. Experience with Docker container related technologies like Kubernetes, Mesos, etc. Experience with Java IDE’s, Source Control and Problem Tracking tools Previous/current Teradata experience or knowledge of relational database engines. Experience with automated deployments and source code / configuration management tools - GitHub, AWS CloudFormation, Jenkins, Chef, Ansible, Puppet, Vagrant, Terraform, etc.

description:
Requisition ID:278890
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student

COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.


About the SAP Internship Experience Program


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP

  • Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
  • Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
  • Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

Data Platform team is responsible to Design, Architect and implement a robust Data Platform (which is a collection of many different Infrastructure) to bring data in (un)structured & semi-structured format to Data Lake or Data Warehouse. Lot of experiments & new technologies getting evaluated to make a appropriate Data driven decisions.

Our group has engineers (senior and entry level) working closely with their respective expertise to solve complex distributed problems.

Candidates having a Data Driven engineering mindset and eager to learn, be part of solving complex problems, this is the group you don’t want to overlook


What you’ll do:

Position title: SAP SuccessFactors iXp Intern – Full-Stack Software Developer

Location: San Ramon, CA

Expected start date to end date: June 7th, 2021 – August 13th, 2021


In this role, you’ll:


Project : Data Platform and Search

Team is currently in the POC/Prototype phase to build the Data Platform where Events which are generated by our business applications will be sent thru our platform which gets categorized and sorted appropriately in *Streaming style* to make data available to upstream analytics or other business pillars to consume in real time. ML & AI models will be applied on the data once its reaches our Data Lake.

For 2021 we have to solidify our prototype and make some architectural decisions with all the experiments and code changes to prove our scalability and resilience story


  • Data Platform is an effort to make SAP SuccessFactors an Data Driven Company to serve or internal & external customers
  • Details are given as part of what Data Platform is all about and what’s our direction towards solving current gap in providing data for our Data Scientist

Who you are:


We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.


  • Engineering and Data Driven mindset
  • MS computer science preferred
  • Programming (Java/Python), Big Data, Data Science
  • JAVA/Python, Linux System knowledge

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!


WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

position: ServiceNow IT/Technical Internship for Active Duty Military (Skillbridge)
description:
Covestic’s SkillBridge ServiceNow Veterans Program seeks to serve those who have served by helping to ease their transition into the civilian world while enabling veterans to put their unique talents to work on behalf of our clients. Partnering with ServiceNow and SkillBridge, the program targets the wide veteran talent pool, forming a skill bridge between military disciplines and world-class consulting.

Covestic has been a ServiceNow partner since 2012 and operates today as an Elite partner with a long-term track record of customer success across some of the most well-known logos and brands in the world. The SkillBridge program will run for a period of 14 weeks with a flex of up to 20 weeks. While much of the program is technically oriented, we also understand the difficulties of career change and military transition which is why our program has built in regular opportunities to address some of those pain points. Participants will have dedicated time for mentorship, job shadowing, resume writing, interview prep, networking, job search, certification, and more.

Candidates will work from their home office and can be located anywhere in the US.

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in extensive discussion and training around what ServiceNow is, what the platform is capable of, and how that translates into value for thousands of major corporations and organizations worldwide.
  • Participate in foundational instruction into how the platform works, including practical application in real world scenarios.
  • Participate in a series of courses, exercises, and projects in the most widely used and in-demand platform areas and applications including IT Service Management, System Administration, Configuration Management Database, Scripting, Service Portal, Performance Analytics, and Workflow Editor/Flow Designer.
  • Deliver capstone project to put all the skills and training received to the test, followed by some final opportunities for certification, resume and interview prep.

Required Qualifications

  • Active-Duty US Military
  • Within 180 days of separation or will be by the start of the program and have at least 180 continuous days of active service
  • Have or will have completed your service components specific Skillbridge prerequisites prior to starting the program
  • Unit Commander approval to participate in a Skillbridge Program
  • Exhibits a high degree of self-directedness and initiative in the recruitment process
  • Detail-oriented and analytic mindset
  • Problem-solver, curious, persistent.
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills, including civility and flexibility as demonstrated in the recruitment process
  • Willingness and ability to work remotely

Preferred Qualifications

  • Technical background or demonstrated experience preferably with a focus on focus on software, networking, or IT systems.
  • Programming or DBMS experience, especially JavaScript
  • Associates degree or equivalent training; Computer science degree
  • Confidential, secret, or top-secret clearance

Covestic is a world-class consulting firm implementing technology solutions that help clients realize greater value from their investments so that they may better scale their business, provide superior customer experiences, and trust that their valuable assets are secure. A talented and diverse workforce being imperative, we foster a supportive environment in which individuals from a variety of backgrounds can realize their full potential. If you are a practiced professional with a passion for technology and teamwork, then join our team.

For immediate consideration, please apply through the link provided or forward your resume directly to polson@covestic.com.

Data Science Intern

About the Organization
Now is a great time to join Redhorse Corporation. Redhorse specializes in developing and implementing creative strategies and solutions with private, state, and federal customers in the areas of cultural and environmental resources services, climate and energy change, information technology, and intelligence services. We are hiring creative, motivated, and talented people with a passion for doing what's right, what's smart, and what works.

Position Description
Redhorse Corporation is seeking a Data Science Intern to join our multi-disciplinary team this summer! Ideal candidates will have experience and or coursework in topic areas related to Data Science, Computer Science, or related domains. Interns will be provided with supplemental technical training to include pertinent software skills, graph analytic capabilities, graph and NoSQL databases, and cognitive computing capabilities. Interns will gain experience in a professional working environment, workflow management, data analytics, machine learning and artificial intelligence, visualizations, solution architecture, and application development using agile methodologies. This is a paid role with prototyping for research and development projects in the data science team’s pipeline.

Minimum basic requirements for the Data Science Intern include:
  • Must be in the process of obtaining a Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or other applicable Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) degree and in good academic standing.
  • Experience programming in one of the following languages: Python, R, JavaScript, Java or C++
  • Any experience or coursework in one or more of the following:
  • Big Data technologies/frameworks such as MapReduce/Hadoop and Apache Spark
  • Database and inventory management, forecasting, and optimization
  • Producing visualizations of data and showcasing results in a meaningful way using tools/frameworks such as D3.js, vis.js, HighCharts, and Keylines
  • Statistical modeling, experimental design, sampling, clustering, data reduction, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing, feature engineering, and predictive modeling
  • Cloud services such as AWS, Google Cloud, and MS Azure
  • Must demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills including documentation.
Preferred Requirements:
  • The ability to translate complex problems into simpler terms, and effectively influence both peers and senior leadership.
  • Familiarity with various SQL and NoSQL databases (MongoDB, MarkLogic, Neo4j, PostgreSQL, etc.)
  • Experience with Unix/Linux, Machine Learning, Tensorflow, or embedded systems
  • Experience training models with CPU/GPU
  • Experience with supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement machine learning techniques such as: Bayesian Networks, SVMs, Artificial Neural Networks, Clustering, Q-learning, etc.
  • Insight into Natural Language Processing and Understanding, Computer Vision, Time Series Analysis, and/or Optimization Problems.
  • Virtual machines and containerization software such as Amazon Machine Images (AMIs), Docker, Kubernetes, etc.
Redhorse Corporation shall, in its discretion, modify or adjust the position to meet Redhorse’s changing needs.
This job description is not a contract and may be adjusted as deemed appropriate in Redhorse’s sole discretion.

position: Intern - Data Science, Marketing Analytics (10 weeks)
description:
QUALIFICATIONS

  • University student in a STEM-related field such as computer science with expected graduation date between December 2021 to June 2022; master’s student completing the first year in a non-business degree or 2-year master’s program with less than 2 years of work experience
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and effectively with people at all levels in an organization
  • Deep understanding of statistical and predictive modeling concepts, machine learning approaches, clustering and classification techniques and recommendation and optimization algorithms
  • Experience in two or more programming languages (R, Python, C++, etc.)
  • Ability to easily understand the complex algorithm and logic to process data
  • Experience working with a large volume of data with the ability to solve performance issues
  • Basic business intuition and clear expertise in analyses with the ability to describe analytic processes including when and why specific approaches are favored
  • Strong command of English language (both verbal and written)
  • Willingness to travel

WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH

You will be based in our Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, New York or San Francisco office as part of our Marketing Analytics team.

This team helps clients transform their marketing and sales by leveraging our Periscope technology platform and applying advanced analytics to generate value-creating insights from big data.

Founded in 2007, Periscope® by McKinsey is an award-winning technology platform that enables better commercial decisions by uncovering actionable insights. The Periscope platform combines world-leading intellectual property, prescriptive analytics, and cloud-based tools to provide more than 25 solutions focused on insights and marketing, with expert support and training. It is a unique combination that drives revenue growth both now and in the future. Customer experience, performance, pricing, category, and sales optimization are powered by the Periscope platform.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

You will perform statistical data analyses, data mining and optimizations using multiple tools and techniques to get insights from large complex data sets.
In this role, you will conduct hands-on rigorous quantitative analysis including getting the data, cleaning it (when necessary/relevant) and exploring it for accuracy. Additionally, you'll deploy statistical modeling and optimization techniques most suited for the business problem (using R, Python, SQL, and/or other relevant tools). You will work across multiple industries to advise client teams on analytic methodologies and approaches to address their specific needs.
The duration of this internship is 10 weeks over the summer.

position: DMED Technology Network Engineer Intern-Remote, Summer 2021
description:
Job Summary:

Comprised of Disney’s international media businesses and the Company’s various streaming services, the Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution (DMED) segment aligns technology, media distribution, and advertising sales into a single business segment to create and deliver personalized entertainment experiences to consumers around the world. Playing an important role in the growth and future of DMED and The Walt Disney Company, the Technology team helps drive the strategic development and deployment of technology at the Walt Disney Company. It creates products, platforms and innovations for Disney’s portfolio of brands and businesses, while building scalable systems that connect hundreds of millions of consumers to Disney’s beloved stories, characters and brands.

As a member of the Global Network Services organization, the Network Engineer Intern will help deploy, scale, and automate the enterprise and production networks in a dynamic, fast-paced, technologically advanced broadcast and content distribution environment.

The organization is tasked with improving workflow efficiency through the use of innovative technological solutions. Our partners demand the highest quality and reliability for their services. Our industry is evolving at a tremendous rate and it is our responsibility to maintain quality and reliability while developing innovative ways to automate the scaling of our network. As a result, we are transitioning to a service-provider model to include 10G, 40G and 100G Ethernet capabilities. Automation is an important component of driving efficiency and the team is responsible for conceiving, developing and deploying tools to support our network infrastructure.

As a Network Engineer Intern, you will participate in the engineering and implementation of network solutions to meet the needs of the business. You will work closely with our Network Architects and internal partners.

Responsibilities:

A Day in the Life...
  • Configure and support multi-vendor, multi-protocol enterprise and production networks
  • Maintain routing/switching configuration consistency throughout the network infrastructure
  • Manage and maintain network monitoring and analysis tools
  • Document and maintain accurate configuration information and infrastructure documentation of all networking components and dependencies.
  • Work with our Network Architects, executing and implementing highly available, high-performance network infrastructure


Basic Qualifications:

What we are looking for...
  • Experience in the technology operations role with demonstrated training and interest in supporting routing and switching configuration efforts
  • Knowledge and experience with major internet routing protocols; specifically, BGP and OSPF
  • Experience scripting with Perl, Python, Ruby, Shell, C or C++
  • Able to provide respectful and courteous customer service often under tight deadlines and in high pressure situations
  • Possesses strong written and verbal communication skills, strong project management and time management skills


Required Education

Freshman, Sophomore, Junior, or Senior level student or recent graduate pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Management Information Systems or related field.

Additional Information:

Internship Eligibility:

  • Must be enrolled in an accredited college/university taking at least one class in the semester/quarter (spring/fall) prior to participation in the internship program OR must have graduated from a college/university within 18 months OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Disney Professional Internship
  • Must be at least 18 years of age
  • Must not have completed one year of continual employment on a Disney internship or program.
  • Must possess unrestricted work authorization
  • Must provide full work availability
  • Must provide own transportation to/from work (if it becomes in-person)
  • Current Active Disney cast members must meet Professional Internship transfer guidelines (for Walt Disney World cast members this is no more than four points and one reprimand in the last six months; for Disneyland cast members this is six months of consecutive service and a performance record clear of any disciplinary issues (warnings, suspensions, etc.) for at least six months)


Program Length: The approximate dates of this internship are 05/17/2021- 08/07/2021. Interns must be fully available for the duration of the internship.

Recommendation – Print or Save This Role Description: Strong candidates may be invited to complete a phone interview. We strongly encourage applicants to print a copy of this role description so they can refer to it in the event they are selected for a phone interview.

At STERIS, we help our Customers create a healthier and safer world by providing innovative healthcare and life science product and service solutions around the globe.

Position Summary:

The Cybersecurity Engineer Intern will be working directly with the STERIS Regulatory Cybersecurity team, internal stakeholders and external security industry partners to ensure that STERIS does its part to defend our critical healthcare products against today’s threats and collaborate as a part of STERIS’ shared responsibility to helping our healthcare Customers build a more secure and resilient healthcare sector infrastructure for the future. The Cybersecurity Engineer Intern will support cyber activities for new product development and sustaining of existing products to develop or improve cyber hygiene in our healthcare products. Through the cyber related activities like static code analysis, vulnerability scanning, web application scanning, security risk assessment, networking and security log analysis, the Cybersecurity Intern will gain experience with incorporating cybersecurity program risk management into the secure product development life cycle of healthcare products developed in a regulated healthcare industry. This role will be based in Point Richmond, CA, but applicants near our Mentor, OH location may also be considered. Position is for Summer 2021 (May-August).

What you will do:

  • Vulnerability scanning & testing
  • Assist with secure software assurance activities
  • Assist with audit log analyses
  • Participate in cyber risk assessments and related analysis activities
  • Help create & execute fuzzing test suite for communication ports
  • Assist with creating cybersecurity risk summary reports
  • Participate in security industry information sharing forum meetings and webinars
  • Work as a collaborate with other functional areas to contribute to cybersecurity deliverables engineering projects

What you will need to be successful:

  • Completion of at least one year in a cyber-related certificate or degree program such as Cybersecurity, Networking, Security, Information Assurance, Information Systems, Information Technology, Computer Science, Software Engineering and or other related fields
  • Coursework in Networking, Security, Systems Administration (Linux or Windows Servers)
  • Lab work or exposure to vulnerability scanning, malware detection and remediation methods
  • Previous experience with virtual machines such as Virtual Box and VM Ware
  • Experience writing scripts with Powershell, Python or similar
  • Experience with code analysis tools
  • Exposure to Metasploit and Kali Linux, desired
  • Exposure to Software Lifecycle Development Processes is desirable but not required
  • Familiarity with the Agile software development methodology and the Scrum process framework is desirable
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Self-motivated and great with multitasking.

#LI-KW1

Offering you in return:

The opportunity to gain real-world experience with Cybersecurity in a corporate setting at a large global organization.


STERIS is a $3B, publicly traded (NYSE: STE) organization with approximately 12,000 associates worldwide and operates in more than 100 countries.

At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.

We are seeking a highly motivated candidate to join our Translational Bioinformatics at BMS for a 10-week summer internship program. This group of scientists is responsible for advancing BMS' industry-leading oncology pipelines by applying cutting-edge computational methods to clinical trial and real-world data for personalized medicine. The position will focus on the application of machine learning methods to predict patient response to immunotherapy using clinical trial data. The successful applicant will receive mentorship from experienced bioinformatics scientists, interact with bioinformaticians and experimental biologists from collaborating groups, and learn the process of drug development in a leading pharmaceutical industry environment.

Key Responsibilities

  • Use existing internal and open-source R codes
  • Integrate clinical and molecular data across multiple clinical trials
  • Assess effect of molecular information (genomics, transcriptomics) on response to therapy
  • Apply machine learning methods on data to predict treatment response
  • Deliver and communicate results for key decision points

Qualifications & Experience

  • Undergraduate or graduate student in bioinformatics, genomics, statistics, computer science or related field.
  • Basic working proficiency in R programming preferred.
  • Ability to apply statistical modeling and machine learning preferred.
  • Hands-on experience in analyzing NGS data preferred.
  • Functional knowledge of R Shiny app development is a plus.
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
  • Ability to work independently and effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.

Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

We are looking for a Data Science Intern who will support our product, sales, leadership and marketing teams with insights gained from analyzing cloud data.

This is a unique opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a new multi-disciplined team of experienced individuals who will be driving the solution design, development, and deployment of advanced machine learning solutions supporting the company’s digital medicine program and other mobile health applications.

The position is within Sikka Artificial Intelligence Lab’s team, which contributes to our autonomous diagnosis, health outcomes and inferencing technology strategy as well as our self-driving practice initiative.

The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams, from databasing and APIs to user engagement data. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide insights into machine learning techniques focused on classification, supervised learning, reinforced learning and eventually deep learning
  • Produce new and creative ML solutions in a landscape may include neural networks, with specific interest and emphasis on classification, supervised and unsupervised learning leading to deep learning systems, computer vision, human-computer interaction
  • Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions
  • Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques
  • Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
  • Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes
  • Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy

Desired technical expertise:

  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
  • Experience working with and creating data architectures.
  • Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
  • Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
  • A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques

We’re looking for someone in the midst of completing their Master’s or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field and is familiar with the following software/tools:

  • Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, etc.
  • Knowledge/Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python
  • Knowledge/Experience using web services: Spark, S3, RedShift, etc.
  • Knowledge/Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.
  • Knowledge/Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, MySQL
  • Knowledge/Experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Neo4J, Neptune, Cassandra, HBase and associated languages (Cypher, Gremlin)

position: SAP Ariba iXp Intern - Full Stack Developer
description:
Requisition ID: 276465
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern
Career Level: NA


COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.


About the SAP Internship Experience Program


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP

  • Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
  • Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
  • Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

The SAP Procurement Engineering team has embarked on an audacious vision to make business commerce as easy as consumer commerce. Every day, we help our customer find opportunities to cut costs, reduce risk, and grow revenue through better collaboration with trading partners. We enable the collaboration through the Ariba Network – a cloud-based community where you will find buying, selling, and managing cash to be as easy as using Amazon, eBay, and PayPal. We also host other online communities where business commerce professionals network and share information and best practices, just like friends on Facebook.


What you’ll do:

Position Title: SAP Ariba iXp Intern - Full Stack Developer

Location: Palo Alto, California

Expected start date to end date: June 7 or 14,2021 – August 13 or 27, 2021


In this role, you’ll:

  • Have the unique opportunity to build and enhance our automation frameworks
  • Integrate Code Coverage tools to Automation frameworks
  • Have the unique opportunity to design, develop and deliver tools of our engineering team to significantly improve productivity and quality
  • Have the unique opportunity to design and develop simulators, validators and integrate them with automation frameworks enabling teams to reach automation goals
  • Design and implement a comprehensive framework to aggregate test results from various sources and generate a unified report


Who you are:

We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.


  • Candidates to currently be enrolled in an undergraduate or master’s degree program which is applicable to the position (computer science or equivalent proven experience).
  • Strong programming skills in Java, JavaScript, SQL, CSS
  • Experience developing rich applications with HTML/CSS/JS
  • Experience in Automation Frameworks (e.g. Selenium, Katalon, Protractor etc)
  • Strong communication skills that include the ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions.
  • Thrive in a fast-paced environment working with multiple teams across various geographies
  • Preferred experience: familiarity with Gradle, Microservices (Springboot), Redis, CI/CD tools using Jenkins, GitHub. Experience building cloud applications (e.g. Google Cloud Platform, AWS and Azure).

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!


WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.
A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team. (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Position Overview:

The Climate Corporation’s data scientists and analysts expertly combine complex data layers (agronomic, grower, supply chain, commercial, clickstream, satellite imagery, genomics, weather) and continually investigate, experiment, and find insights that drive our mission. Combining those complex data sets with scalable technology, they support scientific research, product development, and commercial initiatives.


What You Will Do:

  • Partner with stakeholders (Science, Product, Engineering) to support the execution of data-intensive projects, enable superior decision-making and analysis, and standardize data science practices throughout the organization
  • Enable timely and insightful reports, dashboards, metrics, and advanced analytics to monitor and positively impact the performance of our company
  • Accelerate data science innovation and adoption (machine learning, deep learning, hierarchical modeling) using state-of-the-art frameworks and infrastructure
  • Creatively incorporate data science and statistical methods to the challenges of product development, understanding how science impacts end-user behavior
  • Effectively tell the story behind the data to product partners and propose recommendations to senior management

Basic Qualifications:

  • Currently pursuing a MS or PhD in Statistics, Economics, Data Science, Physics, Computer Science, or other quantitative field
  • Ability to develop and review code using standard languages and frameworks (e.g. Python, TensorFlow) and/or database languages (e.g. SQL) and visualization tools (e.g. Looker)
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to execute research projects, and generate practical results and recommendations

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Background in data science or machine learning engineering
  • Experience and/or interest in cloud computing platforms (e.g. AWS)
  • Experience in translating business questions into appropriate statistical techniques applied to available data
  • Familiarity with experiment design to statistically measure the impact of new product features and commercial campaigns
  • Knowledge of key performance indicators and how they impact business decisions
  • Experience creating data pipelines
  • Enjoy working in a team-oriented, multidisciplinary environment
  • Passion for data and technology


What We Offer:
Our environment is extremely engaging and fast-paced, with a diverse set of top engineers, agronomists, and statisticians working together to provide the best possible products and experiences for our customers.

  • We offer competitive pay and perks.
  • We provide meals and a large assortment of snacks and drinks to get you through the day.
  • You’ll get 1:1 mentoring from a talented and motivated employee on your team.
  • You’ll have the opportunity to work on real projects with experienced employees and have a direct impact on the company. (Our internships are not summer camp!)
  • You’ll have the amazing opportunity to participate in one of our Biotechnology Tours where you get out of the office and into the field (literally) with agents and farmers.
  • You’ll work in an award winning office with smart designs, large common areas and open floor plans that fuel collaboration.
  • You’ll attend various company sponsored events, activities and off-sites - we make sure interns are having fun!
  • We regularly host meet-up groups and tech-talks and encourage participation in relevant workshops and conferences
  • You’ll have the opportunity to interaction with key executives and leadership.


We also hinge our cultural DNA on these five values:

  • Inspire one another
  • Innovate in all we do
  • Leave a mark on the world
  • Find the possible in the impossible
  • Be direct and transparent


Learn more about our team and our mission:

The Climate Corporation - The Technology Behind Making A Difference

https://youtu.be/c5TgbpE9UBI or visit https://climate.com/careers


Climate aims to create a welcoming and collaborative environment for our employees in which a diverse set of perspectives and voices are represented and celebrated.

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, The Climate Corporation is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, sex (including pregnancy), protected veteran status, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, or any unlawful criterion existing under applicable federal, state, or local laws. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@climate.com.

position: Research Internship - Summer 2021 (NLP, Computer Vision, or Machine Learning)
description:
Type: Internship
Experience: PhD/Graduate Students

Who we are:

Dataminr puts real-time AI and public data to work for our clients, generating relevant and actionable alerts for global corporations, public sector agencies, newsrooms, and NGOs. Our leading AI platform detects the earliest signals of high-impact events and emerging risks from vast amounts of publicly available information. Our real-time alerts enable tens of thousands of users at hundreds of public and private sector organizations to learn first of breaking events around the world, develop effective risk mitigation strategies, and respond with confidence as crises unfold.

Dataminr is making its mark for growth and innovation, recently earning recognition on the Deloitte Technology Fast 500, Forbes AI 50 and Forbes Cloud 100 lists. We also earned accolades for 'Most Innovative Use of AI' from the 2020 AI & Machine Learning Awards.

Join our team and help the world manage risk in real time. You'll work with 600+ talented people across seven offices, united by our passion to collaborate, make a difference, and have fun while doing it!

Who you are:

You're a Ph.D. candidate who has published in top tier conferences and are passionate about having a positive impact on the world. You are enthusiastic about working on some of the most challenging problems in AI, working in a highly collaborative environment and directly contributing to products while advancing the state of the art. You are very creative, can work independently, and are an excellent collaborator and communicator.

Responsibilities:

  • Perform research to advance the state of the art and solve specific problems at scale in one or more of the following areas: NLP, HCI, Machine Learning/Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Complex Networks.
  • Work closely with a diverse, interdisciplinary team on a specific project to be completed during the internship.
  • Excel in placing a human-centered focus on the work (context, end-user impact, etc), finding solutions that work in practice and have significant impact.

Minimum qualifications:


  • Must be enrolled in a Ph.D. program in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or a related field.
  • Ideal candidates will have had prior internship experience.
  • Outstanding publication record in the candidate's field of study (ACL, CVPR, CHI, WWW, RecSys, ICCV, NIPS, ICML, etc.).
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently, set up experiments and demonstrate progress through principled used of metrics.

Dataminr is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Individuals seeking employment at Dataminr are considered without regards to race, sex, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, genetics, marital status, pregnancy, unemployment status, sexual orientation, citizenship status or veteran status.

That sub part or assembly will fit into larger assemblies designed by other engineers, so there will need to be coordination and communication between multiple parties. The parts will eventually be made into physical prototypes that may be outside the scope of the initial project but would require validation of design and incorporation of feedback and design improvements for a subsequent build.

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for design and analysis of systems, equipment and packages. Conducts feasibility studies and testing on new and modified designs.
  • Awareness and familiarity with relevant subject matter knowledge including technologies, theories, or techniques.
  • Contributes to the development of innovative principles and ideas.
  • Successfully operates in and between the most complex disciplines in the company such as electrical, mechanical, thermal, software and

    power engineering. Works on extremely complex problems and provides highly innovative solutions.

  • Takes direction from senior system architects in developing methods, techniques and criteria for achieving objectives.

Education/Requirements:

  • Must currently be enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or related field
  • Understanding of Engineering principles and ability to apply them effectively

Job Title: Information Security Systems Engineer (Intern - Herndon, VA)

Job Code: IMS20212402-57124

Job Location: Herndon, VA

Job Description:

Seeking an Information Systems Security Engineer to join the ISSE Team and L3Harris Adaptive Methods in Herndon, VA. This role will help support the configuration, administration, and maintenance of the Engineering infrastructure and assets. This includes, but not limited to, supporting Linux and Windows system administration, assisting with building, configuration, and maintaining Linux and Windows Engineering operating environments, performing end-user support tasks, and supporting Industry cybersecurity compliance efforts

Essential Functions:

  • TIER I/II Linux and Windows administration and maintenance
  • Supporting the ISSE Leads in the building, configuration, maintenance, and administration of Linux and Windows engineering environments
  • Assisting with the implementation and maintenance of cybersecurity settings, practices, and policies
  • Documentation
  • Assisting with the maintenance of engineering asset inventory

Qualifications:

  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology/Computer Information Systems with Network Focus or Communications Focus, Electrical Engineering or related field
  • GPA of 3.0 or greater

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience in Linux / Windows administration
  • Experience using Windows Office Suite
  • Strong Communication Skills (written / oral)
  • Physical ability to work in server room environment (climb ladders, lift approx. 40lbs, etc.)
  • Current SECRET Clearance
  • Experience with Linux / Windows shell scripting (Bash, powershell, etc.)
  • Experience with network security
  • Experience with operating system management tools (puppet, ansible, etc.)

Position Description

  • Assist in the analysis, design and development of building a digital duplicate of customers business
  • Roadmap and implementation based upon a current vs. future state in a cohesive architecture viewpoint
  • Working with the team to develop the business case on a project initiative
  • Participate in the technical and business discussions relative to future architect direction
  • Gather and analyze data and develop architectural requirements at project level
  • Participate in improving the EA (Enterprise Architecture) governance model
  • Support the development software and data delivery platforms that are service-oriented with reusable components that can be orchestrated together into different methods for different businesses
  • Research and evaluate emerging technology, industry and market trends to assist in project development and/or operational support activities.
  • Sharing knowledge and experiences with members of the organization


Background/Experience

  • Knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) from discovery to delivery with focus on design and architecture is helpful
  • Must be motivated, self-starter and have the ability to work independently with minimal supervision
  • Organizational skills, strong communicator, professional in appearance and demeanor
  • Experience in preparing/delivering group presentations


Education

  • Pursuing Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Technology, Business or related degree is preferred
  • Previous internship experience supporting solutions architecture is preferred


This position is a summer internship beginning June 2021 for 10+ weeks. It is possible to work remote for the internship period.

Join our team! First American's Mortgage Solutions division provides lenders with solutions to originate, close and service quality loans. As a global leader in providing title insurance, settlement services and risk solutions for real estate transactions, First American (NYSE: FAF) is an ideal place to build your career. We have been entrusted with helping our customers achieve and protect their dream of homeownership since 1889. We believe that our people are the key to the company’s continued success, and we invest in diverse talents and backgrounds and empower our teams to achieve more than they could anywhere else. First American has created an award-winning culture and has been named to the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for the fifth consecutive year and to more than 50 regional Best Places to Work lists. For more information, please visit www.firstam.com/mortgagesolutions/

Job Summary

The First American Integration Analyst intern will work in a program designed to help college students gain experience and develop the technology, professional and interpersonal skills to use throughout their career. First American Interns work in a corporate environment within the Financial/Title Industry—balanced with intern-specific activities, executive-level presentations, and networking opportunities—while under the close supervision and guidance of a manager and/or mentor.

Essential Functions
  • Work collaboratively with business leaders to identify and define the business requirements, technical solutions, and integration architecture to automate business process
  • Define integration points, data flow, integration strategy and develop functional and technical specifications test plans
  • Become a strategic partner to business leaders by analyzing, designing, and building new logic and flows in our internal business systems
  • Responsible to ensure data integrity, extraction, analyzing, and transforming data
  • Participates in technical assessments and reviews to validate the technical approach and associated work products

Knowledge and Skills/Technology Used
  • Current student pursuing a BS degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, or Data Science
  • Understanding of Database structures and relationships
  • Understanding of basic data structures and formats (JSON, XML)
  • Understanding of REST API’s
  • Postman knowledge is a plus
  • Analytical and data-driven mindset
  • Attention to detail and document repeatable processes
  • The ability to solve problems, be detailed oriented and be conscientious about all work completed.
  • Outstanding interpersonal skills.

First American invests in its employees' development and well-being, empowers them to provide superior customer service and encourages them to serve the communities where they live and work. First American is committed to diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer.

Job Description Summary

Job Description

POSITION SUMMARY

The Data Analyst, Internal Audit will focus on driving data analytics/data science efforts that support internal audits and the development of a continuous auditing program. The position provides knowledge and experience of information systems, data analytics, data science, advanced data analysis tools and techniques, operational audit processes and objectives, and business processes. This position will work on large complex financial and non-financial problems using large datasets and apply array of advanced data science technologies.


RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Develops and implements operational and tactical plans related to the implementation of data analysis in support of the Internal Audit function's goals and objectives. Consults and networks with management to develop leading practices and synergies of audit data analytics tactics, techniques, and procedures.
  • Develops data analytics standards, strategies, and procedures in support of audits and projects.
  • Partners with the members of the Internal Audit management team.
  • Develops strong written deliverables, including reports and dashboards with business-relevant information. Presents analytics results to senior business leaders and Internal Audit leadership.
  • Contributes to the design and development of continuous auditing and controls monitoring dashboards across multiple, disparate business areas.
  • Understands industry-specific and relevant data analytics, business intelligence and quantitative analysis trends, techniques, and leading practices.
  • Works with extremely large and complex data sets. Requires technical expertise and capacity to assist in the most complex data analytics efforts.
  • Confers with business leaders, peers and managers to discuss audit business intelligence and audit quantitative analytic activities in order to resolve problems and recommend solutions.
  • Train Internal Audit team members on use of analytics and the development of related objectives.
  • Develop in-depth subject-matter-expertise in understanding key data sources and data lineage within the organization and effectively leverages knowledge to derive meaningful audit data analytics results.
  • Advise and fulfill data analytics requests by auditors to address their specific needs, including data extractions using various business intelligence tools and programming software.
  • Develop complex queries capable of aggregating data from multiple tables and assist in the evaluation of opportunities to deploy data analytics capabilities to expand internal audit coverage.
  • Collaborate with business and technology stakeholders across the firm to stay abreast of changes to the data architecture and source new data for use in Audit Analytics


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS


  • Bachelor's degree in a related field, such as Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, etc with a minimum of 3-5 years of experience.
  • Experience in data analytics, systems analysis, data warehousing and/or audit.
  • Professional experience managing resources, effective team interactions, providing timely and constructive feedback, negotiating issues and resolving problems.
  • Experience in the use of data analytics tools including experience in the management and/or use of data analytics tools and platforms such as SQL, IDEA, ACL, Alteryx, Tableau, R, PowerBI, Python, Hadoop, Teradata, and/or Splunk.
  • Experience with ERP and Non-ERP systems data such as SAP, Oracle, JDE, Salesforce, ServiceMax, etc.


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS


  • Master's degree preferred.
  • Knowledge of data analytics in an audit environment.
  • Desired knowledge of health and medical devices regulations; internal audit practices; risk management; and regulatory guidance and expectations (HIPPA, HITECH, FCPA, SOX).
  • Strong knowledge and experience developing and delivering data analytics and continuous auditing/continuous monitoring programs.
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills.

What is iManage U?

iManage U provides students the chance to experience a dynamic, rapid growth technology company firsthand. iManage will provide a structured program which delivers project-based activities, improved knowledge of business fundamentals, tackling complex problem solving, collaboration, team building, and some fun experiences along the way! This year, our paid internship program will kick-off on Monday, June 7th and will run through Friday, August 13th.

Goals of the Program:

  • iM Making An Impact: Leave your mark on your team by owning and completing assigned projects
  • iM A Mentee: Learn from teammates across departments & gain perspectives from a diversity of people
  • iM A Connector: Meet & connect with as many interns and iManage employees as possible
  • iM Inspired: Learn from our leadership team and ask questions during our virtual lunch and learns
  • iM Social: Enjoy virtual events, and everything iManage has to offer this summer

Being an intern within our Technology Group means….

Joining our team of Software Engineers who are the heart of our company here at iManage. In this internship, you will have the opportunity to be immersed within our iManage product suite and gain exposure into the development lifecycle. You will learn about our flagship product in document management and work with fellow interns and engineers on projects that will directly impact our team and business. If you have a strong passion for development and learning new technologies along the way, come and join our Technology Group this summer!

iM Responsible For…

  • Designing and developing features for iManage cloud products in an agile environment, and implementing them into production
  • Learning and applying modern cloud computing concepts utilizing containers, micro-services, etc.
  • Following best practices in Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery with tools like Jenkins, Maven, Sonar, Docker, GitHub, Jira etc.
  • Working within cross-functional engineering teams as well as peer teams to help build solutions

iM Qualified Because I Have…

  • Been pursuing your bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science or other technology related field
  • Programming language experience (Java, Python, C++, C#, etc.)
  • Solid understanding of Computer Science fundamentals, course work in algorithms, database systems and design, data processing, networking fundamentals and security
  • Demonstrated interest and ability to learn other coding languages
  • Excellent written and communication skills

About iManage

iManage combines artificial intelligence with content and email management to free, secure, and understand information. Over 3000 companies and 1 million users worldwide rely on our market-leading software to share and protect their most valuable data. Our work is not always easy but it is ambitious and rewarding.

So we’re looking for people who love a challenge. People who are happiest when they’re solving problems and collaborating with the industry’s best and brightest. In exchange, we’ll make sure the work you do here is worth doing. That’s the iManage way. It’s how we do things that might appear impossible. How we develop our employees’ strengths and unlock their potential. It’s how we find meaning in everything we do.

Whoever you are, whatever you do, however you work. Make it mean something at iManage.

Learn more at: www.imanage.com

Please see our privacy statement for more information on how we handle your personal data: https://imanage.com/privacy-policy/
