Tynker is looking for a creative, data-driven social media intern to maintain and grow our social media presence. If you're passionate about children, creative, uber-organized, and a quick thinker, this is the position for you! You'll be responsible for managing and expanding our audiences, mapping to our marketing goals as you go.

Our mission is to provide children with 21st century skills through an engaging coding education. If you care about preparing kids to tackle a technology-centric world and want to make an impact, Tynker is the place for you!

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Define and implement social media strategy for Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Youtube, and Pinterest
  • Lead our Featured Maker program; interview exceptional users, write their stories, and post the articles on our blog
  • Maintain an on-brand social media presence and engage with our audiences
  • Plan and execute campaigns and contests to engage and grow our audience
  • Set goals, then track and report growth and engagement metrics
  • Stay up-to-date on changing social media trends, rules, algorithms, and norms
  • Identify and engage with influencers across each channel
  • Create social media content calendars and imagery
  • Author, edit, and proofread marketing copy for social media initiatives
  • Understand our audience on each channel and adjust marketing accordingly
  • Leverage existing blog content on social media and occasionally author new knowledge articles
Qualifications and Requirements:
  • BA or BS in marketing, communication, English, or journalism from an accredited university
  • 2+ years of social media marketing experience
  • Experience with planning, managing, and executing social media marketing campaigns
  • Strong grasp on all social media platforms, including but not limited to Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and Pinterest
  • Impeccable skill set in grammar, writing and editing
  • Good eye for design - Photoshop or Illustrator skills a plus
  • Exceptional written and oral communication skills
  • Experience communicating with children
  • Strong sense of urgency, high motivation, and an intense focus on growth
  • Excellent computer skills (Outlook, Word, Excel, etc.)
  • Ability to learn and be self-motivated in a fast-paced environment
  • Some computer science or coding experience a plus

company: Current Job Openings at Vouch Insurance
description:
About Vouch:

Insurance... sounds slow, old-fashioned, and unexciting. Exactly. Insurance is broken, and it's failing fast-moving, innovative startups.

Vouch is a new, technology-first insurance company, backed with $100M in funding from world-class investors. Like Stripe for payments or Brex for credit cards, Vouch is creating the go-to business insurance for high growth companies.

We're doing this by making insurance fast, responsive, and focused on our customer -high growth and innovative companies. Instead of printed PDF applications and week-long waits, Vouch is building new technology to solve real problems, writing policies that actually cover relevant startup scenarios, and designing simple experiences in an otherwise frustrating industry.

Role Responsibilities:

To deliver on this exciting category-defining product we are seeking a creative, motivated, and innovative data analytics intern to expand our analytical capabilities and drive unique insights from insurance datasets. This role has a high degree of exposure to leaders across several functions in the organization, and many development opportunities for a self-motivated individual.

You will play an integral role in developing analytical processes that support Vouch's mission of crafting the best insurance for those building the future. A highly qualified intern can work with multiple sources of seemingly disjoint data and a set of broad goals Vouch wants to achieve, and can take the initiative to extract insights and make actionable recommendations for our Underwriting leadership.

Specific activities and responsibilities may include:

  • Apply statistical inference to insurance data to draw insights about claims, customer behaviors, and emerging risk trends
  • Establish and deliver best practices related to analytical methodologies
  • Creation of unorthodox analytical techniques to support development of new insurance products
  • Qualitative and quantitative research on competitor insurance innovations and applicability to Vouch's underwriting

Qualifications:

  • Current college junior, senior, or graduate student
  • Concentration in Statistics, Economics, Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Data Science or a similar quantitative field. Majors in business or risk management may also be considered with demonstrated analytical skills
  • Programming and data analytics experience in R, Python, or similar languages
  • Proficiency in Excel and Microsoft Office products
  • Understanding of commercial insurance products and the willingness to rapidly learn about new insurance developments
  • Exceptional communication skills, with an emphasis on real-time interaction, either written or verbal
  • Ability to effectively manage multiple projects and prioritize high impact work

Nice to Have:

  • Experience querying data in SQL
  • Prior internship experience in underwriting, business analytics, or actuarial science
  • Demonstrated interest in commercial insurance products especially Professional Liability, Cyber, Property, and General Liability
  • Demonstrated success in statistics and computer science and coursework
  • Exposure to early-stage startups and/or high growth environments

Vouch believes in putting our people first and building a diverse team is at the front of everything that we do. We welcome people from different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate the diversity of our growing team.

We're looking for an energetic and enthusiastic professional with excellent verbal and written communication skills to help with a variety of marketing communication and sales-related projects. The individual must be highly motivated, passionate and be willing to roll up their sleeves and make things happen. In this role, you will collaborate closely with our sales and marketing team and work on several projects that are critical to our success. Your main responsibilities will include researching and concisely documenting customer needs and pain points, clearly mapping Tynker’s solution to customer requirements, and communicating the benefits of adopting Tynker.

Our mission is to provide every child with solid foundations in critical thinking skills to equip them for today's digital world. If you are passionate about preparing kids for the next millennium in computer science, and love a career in sales or marketing, your job search stops right here. All that is required of you is an eagerness to learn, and the desire to change your life and the lives of the children we serve for the better.

  • High-energy, drive, and ambition with the ability to transition into a sales role
  • Must have a strong desire to succeed
  • Excellent verbal, written communication and listening skills
  • Past experience with creating sales and marketing communications
  • Sales experience such as cold calling is a big plus
  • Comfortable with software and Internet products and services
  • Comfortable with web presentation technologies like GotoMeeting and Google Hangouts

Join us as we pursue our mission to remove the barriers between data and action. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, our customers, having fun, and most importantly to each other’s success.

Role:

The Corporate Strategy team at Splunk is focused on getting results for the company through performance management, operational cadence, and strategic initiatives, and is broadly aligned to the functions within our organization.

As an MBA intern on the Corporate Strategy team, you will help develop and execute strategies that drive growth and operational improvements in the business. Projects include conducting market and customer research to drive new opportunities for growth and expansion, uncovering customer and market insights, and driving business projects. You will also partner with your Corporate Strategy team members to measure and track critical initiatives, and assist in the preparation of content for Executive discussions.

In this role, you will work on highly sophisticated problems, gain insight into the strategic issues which are forefront in the minds of the leadership team, have exposure to senior-level decision-making and have the chance to create relationships with people across the company.

We are looking for a strong analytic background and have competencies in all areas of strategy development and execution including project management, business analysis and problem solving. We look for hardworking people with strong executive communication and consensus building capabilities. Demonstrated ability to thrive in an unstructured, collaborative environment is ideal. Management consulting and technology market experience is appreciated.

This position is based out of San Francisco or San Jose and is reporting to a Director on the Corporate Strategy team.

Responsibilities: I want to and can do that!

  • Drive market intelligence for Splunk; Work cross-functionally to research problems, analyze opportunities, and work towards solutions and meaningful recommendations and results through a thorough, fact-based process.
  • Provide insights to the business through analytics and market research as required (e.g. market, customer, competitors).
  • Develop strategic and business cases working with cross-functional teams outlining business opportunity, rationale, and operating plans to capture the opportunity including product, GTM strategies, and business model.

Requirements: I’ve already done that or have that!

  • Pre or post-graduate experience in strategy, business operations in a technology company, or top-tier consulting firm / corporate strategy field with strong exposure to technology.
  • Experience driving large initiatives from framing the problem, conducting research / analysis to building the business and operational plans through to driving execution to success is required.
  • Strong written / verbal communications to work with senior executives across various geographies and functions; comfort in business and technical discussions.
  • Strong data handling and financial skills to work on sophisticated business issues with minimum supervision.
  • Self-starter who enjoys working in a fast-paced, collaborative, and innovative high-growth environment.

Education:

  • Currently enrolled in an MBA program.
  • Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related subject area is appreciated.

We offer competitive pay and benefits for qualified hires. We look forward to reviewing all resumes and will contact candidates who meet the requirements.

We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.

JD Business Growth Team is looking for PhD student interns to work on a wide variety of research areas in machine learning and recommendation system, including ads ranking, ctr prediction, deep learning, reinforcement learning, etc.

Qualifications:

  • Ph.D. or master's degree in computer science, machine learning related field.
  • Ability to communicate/collaborate with other researchers/engineers including our team members in China (ability to speak Chinese is NOT required)
  • Ability to implement experiments using scripting languages (Python, Perl, bash) and tools written in C/C++.
  • Experience working with deep learning frameworks (Tensorflow, Pytorch, Torch, etc.) and related tools in each special field;
  • Publication record in top conferences (ICML, ICLR, NIPS, KDD, IJCAI, AAAI, RecSys etc ) is a plus.

About JD-Business Growth

The Business Growth BU at JD.com was established in 2011. The engineering team is a group of dynamic geeks from world-class universities and industry-leading companies working in fields such as machine learning, analytics, statistics, NLP, information retrieval, system infrastructures, etc., based in Beijing and Mountain View, CA. We do battle every single day with some of the most significant, rewarding and fun problems in the technology industry, including but not limited to search/display, ads retrieval and recommendation, spam-traffic and click-farm detection, AI/machine learning infrastructure development, traffic and revenue prediction, ads pricing, audience expansion, etc., and we are looking to add great talent to our growing family!

JD.com is an Equal Opportunity Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.

**Please note: We are currently working remotely until it is deemed safe and appropriate to return to our downtown Chicago office.

position: University Relations - Customer Service Intern - Data Automation - Chicago/Marion/Richardson

description:
Why Intern at Health Care Service Corporation?

Health Care Service Corporation (HCSC), a Mutual Legal Reserve Company and an Independent Licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association, is the largest customer-owned health insurer in the United States and fourth largest overall, operating through our Blue Cross and Blue Shield® Plans in Illinois, Montana, New Mexico, Oklahoma and Texas. HCSC affiliates and subsidiaries such as Dearborn National®, TMG Health and Medecision, offer group life, disability and dental solutions, as well as a range of other individual solutions. The company, founded in 1936, serves nearly 15 million members across five states and employs more than 21,000 people in over 60 local offices. HCSC is dedicated to expanding access to high quality, cost effective health care and equipping our members with information and tools so they can make the best health care decisions for themselves and their families. Our health plans were pioneers in their states, as they were the first to provide coverage for a number of procedures ranging from heart and bone marrow transplants, to cancer and leukemia treatments. Today, we are leaders in the development of value-based care models to spur greater collaboration and accountability among various stakeholders to improve the health care experience for patients and consumers and enable them lead healthier lives.

This ten-week paid internship can be located in Chicago, IL, Marion, IL OR Richardson, TX.

What Are Your Responsibilities?

This position is responsible for applying emerging technologies to assist with developing sophisticated database solutions. Working closely with cross-functional teams in both our business and technical areas. Supporting work done to analyze and define requirements associated with operational efficiency within HCSC's Customer Service division and translate them into functional design documents. Partnering with the team to design, test, and implement technical production automation solutions to achieve business objectives by utilizing JAVA, Visual Basic, or any other industry approved software and providing customer support on internally developed applications and processes.

– Respond to help desk tickets
– Code automation applications
– Keep abreast of automation tools and processes in production and under development
– Create documentation to support departmental process improvements and workflows
– Create and analyze business specific reports and ad-hoc reports
– Transform business requirements into technical solutions utilizing VB.Net, C#, and SQL database design and data manipulation

What Do You Need To Be Successful?

– Prior internship experience in database design, automation and/or data manipulation is a plus
– Basic coding experience in VB.Net, C# and/or SQL is a plus
– Demonstrated interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication
– Strong analytical skills
– Practical, developed PC skills, especially Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, Outlook and virtual team collaboration tools

What Are the Requirements You Must Meet?

– Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or other relevant technical degree
– Graduation date between December 2021 – June 2022
– A minimum GPA of 3.0/4.0
– Availability to work 10 weeks during the summer
– Unrestricted authorization to work in the United States

What Does the Internship Program Entail?

– Formal Intern Orientation to build business and industry acumen
– Challenging real-world hands-on project
– Weekly networking opportunities among interns and company leaders
– Professional development workshops
– Business Resource Group involvement
– Volunteer activities

Interos, founded by Jennifer Bisceglie, is one of the most transformative technologically advanced platforms that powers the global economy supply chain. By using ML and big data, Interos aspires to dynamically and continuously map all of a company's business relationships to multiple tiers of dependency on a global scale and endeavors to help customers understand risk in their multi-tier, global supply chains. The scope of this value proposition extends across a variety of different technology sectors including risk management, supply chain intelligence, financial intelligence and cyber-security. Interos has raised $26M in total funding from Venrock, led by Nick Beim, and Kleiner Perkins, led by Ted Schlein. We have doubled in size in 2020 and are planning a similar trajectory in 2021. Our offices are headquartered in Arlington, VA, we have presence in Menlo Park, CA and are hiring across the nation for remote team members.

We need an extraordinary team member who thrives as part of a fast-paced team and takes pride in their ability to succeed while delivering value to our customers. Be challenged by innovation and grow professionally by solving one of the most interesting challenges impacting businesses across the globe.

Interos is changing the future now on how organizations find risk and innovation in their network of business relationships (supply chain). We are looking for Software Engineer Interns who are curious, detail oriented and want to be entrusted with real responsibility and embrace the opportunity to make our product better. You will be a full member of the Application Development team and learning to solve real world problems.   • Bringing a passion to stay current with technology, experimenting with and learning new technologies.

We are not married to specific tools, technologies, or shiny objects. We ask questions until we arrive at the best answer to the patient. We believe glycoproteins are a new language of biology we are translating for the benefit of patients, researchers, science, and medicine. We have diverse backgrounds and experiences, skeptical about the status quo yet solution-oriented. If this sounds like a good fit, read on.

DETAILS
The intern will be responsible for executing one core project over the course of the summer, and for presenting the results to the greater company. This project will require immersing themselves in a new layer of biomarker data, extensive programming in R or python, and experimentation with advanced feature engineering and machine learning.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Gain an understanding of biomarker data, particularly proteomics and glycoproteomics.
  • Work within a fast-paced data science team in an emerging area of biotech
  • Devise a study plan to engineer new, useful features from existing glycoprotein data
  • Employ said features in the classification of real-world cancer datasets.
  • Present final design, code, and findings to InterVenn.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Enrolled in a Master’s program in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Bioinformatics, or Computer Science
  • Alternatively, finalizing a Bachelor’s degree in the same fields, with relevant programming experience.
  • Experience programming in R or Python
  • Familiarity with machine learning concepts such as cross-validation and feature engineering
  • Interest in fundamental biology and a desire to work in biotech.

At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.

We are seeking an innovative and motivated graduate student scientist to join our team for the duration of this internship. This group of computational scientists is responsible for advancing Bristol-Myers Squibb’s industry-leading pipeline in multiple therapeutic areas (including Immuno-Oncology, Cardiovascular, Fibrosis, and Immunoscience) through the strategic application of cutting-edge bioinformatics approaches.

The scientists in this group analyze both pre-clinical and clinical -omics data sets, including RNA-Seq, Exome and Whole Genome Sequencing, single-cell sequencing, high-throughput proteomics, and multiplex flow cytometry to nominate novel drug targets, enable patient enrichment strategies, and guide drug development decisions. The group interacts with and influences all aspects of R&D at BMS, from early discovery through late-stage development.

This internship position will provide the scientist with knowledge of the type of NGS data analysis we perform, the computational platforms we use, and the ability to further expand our NGS capabilities. There are multiple projects this scientist will be able to contribute to, including: 1) develop machine-learning analysis pipelines applied to NGS data; 2) develop an analysis pipeline mapping whole-exome and bulk RNA-Seq samples to HLA regions of the human genomes; 3) improve our production-grade pipelines to annotate NGS samples with computationally derived annotation; 4) develop a computational platform-agnostic mechanism to deploy analysis pipelines.

Key Responsibilities

  • Establish prototype of proposed analysis to prove effectiveness.
  • Apply pipeline to existing clinical trial data to explore results that could potentially impact results.
  • Identify potential QC issues and limitations with using this framework.
  • Communicate problems, findings and methods with other scientists throughout this process.
  • Recommend best practices.

Qualifications & Experience

  • Senior M.S. or Ph.D. graduate student in Bioinformatics, Computer Science or related field, no work experience necessary.
  • Fluency with Linux-based high-performance computing environments, including python, Linux shell scripting, ssh and git
  • Experience with DNASeq and RNAseq pipelines and data a plus
  • Extensive hands on experience with common NGS tools (GATK, picard, etc) a plus
  • Strong problem-solving and collaboration skills, and rigorous and creative thinking
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, including an ability to explain complex ideas to computational scientists, experimentalists, and clinicians
  • The ability to work across organizations to define and solve problems that will benefit the whole. Capable of establishing strong working relationships across the organization.

Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

Be Part of Building the Future

Dremio is the data lake engine company. Our mission is to reshape the world of analytics to deliver on the promise of data with a fundamentally new architecture, purpose-built for the exploding trend towards cloud data lake storage. Dremio eliminates the need for the complex and expensive workarounds that have been in use for decades, such as data warehouses (whether on-premises or cloud-native), structural data prep, ETL, cubes and extracts. We do this by enabling lightning-fast queries directly against data lake storage, combined with full self-service for data users and full governance and control for IT. The results for enterprises are extremely compelling: 100X faster time to insight; 10X greater efficiency; zero data copies; and game-changing simplicity. And equally compelling is the market opportunity for Dremio—with our newly attained unicorn status, we are well on our way to disrupting a $25BN+ market.

If you, like us, say "bring it on" to exciting challenges that really do change the world (no BS), we have endless opportunities where you can make your mark.

What we offer

  • A chance to work with world-class experts on challenging projects

About AppHarvest
AppHarvest is redefining American agriculture by developing modern, large-scale controlled environment agriculture facilities in Central Appalachia. We're combining conventional agriculture techniques with the most recent proven to grow fruits and vegetables that are locally grown, climate resilient, free of chemical pesticides, and resource efficient. We provide access to a nutritious and safe U.S.-grown food supply for consumers.
We're currently operating one of the largest greenhouses in North America, 60-acre controlled environment agriculture facility in Morehead, KY, and have an active development pipeline for additional facilities. These facilities grow more with fewer resources. When compared to traditional agriculture, we grow 30x more efficiently and with 90% less water. Located within a day's drive of 70% of the U.S. population, our base in Appalachia allows us to pick our fruits and veggies when they are at peak nutrition and reduce diesel use in transportation by 80%.
AppHarvest is proud to verify our commitment to people and the planet by being a Certified B Corporation. As one of only four public B Corps in the United States, we are focused on balancing people and profit. Our goal is to promote a future of sustainable change in the agriculture industry while reducing our impact on the planet. And we're doing it all while creating jobs and helping Appalachia build a more resilient economy!
This is Farming Now.

About AppHarvest Internships:

As an AppHarvest Intern, you will join a team at the forefront of redefining sustainable agriculture. You'll participate in a 12-week program designed to provide you with real-world work projects, as well as formal training and other networking designed to educate you on AppHarvest's mission. No matter the intern role, you will be a part of a team committed to transforming agriculture around the world from right here from home in Appalachia. This role will be based in Lexington, Kentucky.

Operations Interns will learn how to analyze crop data, manipulate semi-autonomous robotics systems, and integrate new technologies to a controlled environment ag system. AppHarvest is building the world's most technologically advanced greenhouses and as a Operations Intern you will be at the forefront of our mission.

What You'll Do:

  • Work with the growing team to collect plant measurements and understand all methods of pollination
  • Assemble and operate a semi-autonomous pollinating robot
  • Present pollination data to leaders within AppHarvest and Arugga
  • Gain a thorough understanding of technologies implemented in the greenhouse

What We're Looking For:

  • Currently pursuing a bachelor's degree in Computer sciences, robotics, agriculture, engineering, and/or related field
  • 3.0+ GPA preferred
  • Passionate to learn advanced technology in controlled environment ag
  • Experience with Microsoft programs
  • Collaborative and innovative spirit
  • A great communicator – excellent written and verbal skills
  • Knowledge of the ag field and/or interest in ag preferred but not required
  • Mechanical/electronic skills preferred

About Atos

Atos is a global leader in digital transformation with over 110,000 employees in 73 countries and annual revenue of over € 11 billion. European number one in Cloud, Cybersecurity and High-Performance Computing, the Group provides end-to-end Orchestrated Hybrid Cloud, Big Data, Business Applications and Digital Workplace solutions. The group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and operates under the brands Atos, Atos Syntel, and Unify. Atos is a SE (Societas Europaea), listed on the CAC40 Paris stock index.

The purpose of Atos is to help design the future of the information technology space. Its expertise and services support the development of knowledge, education as well as multicultural and pluralistic approaches to research that contribute to scientific and technological excellence. Across the world, the group enables its customers, employees and collaborators, and members of societies at large to live, work and develop sustainably and confidently in the information technology space.

Position Title -

Software Engineering Intern

Location -

Boca Raton, FL

Duration -

Must be available to work on-site for 12 months

Position Summary -

Are you looking for an engaging opportunity to gain real-world experience as a software engineer? Do you want to help us develop an exciting product? Atos is seeking hardworking, creative students to join our team to support the software development cycle of our industry leading web collaboration application, Circuit. Enterprises worldwide use Circuit for their employees and partners to collaborate using messaging, audio, video, and screen sharing.

This is your opportunity to increase your knowledge with an internship that offers well-rounded and relevant hands-on experience.

Core Responsibilities -

In this position, you will support software development (requirements, development, automated and manual test and validation) for Circuit - www.circuit.com.

You will have the opportunity to support a text, audio, video, screen share (using WebRTC) product that runs on Chrome, IE, Firefox, iOS, Android, Electron
Engineer interns will work on related plug-ins, clients and SDKs to interface and integrate with other products like Microsoft Exchange, Google Drive, VMWare Virtual Desktop, etc.
You will work in a dynamic agile team setup.
You may be assigned in any area of the development cycle.
You will work with a product development team and learn to use leading edge technologies to develop your skills.

Minimum Qualifications -

Junior or senior level student enrolled in an accredited university and pursuing a graduate or undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent.
Minimum 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale.
Demonstrated knowledge in several or more of the following technologies: Java, JavaScript, Swift, Linux command line, Node.js, AngularJS, HTML, CSS and are an eager learner.
Ability to transform manual tasks into code.
Good verbal and written communication skills.

Preferred -

Strong foundation in software, leadership, problem solving, analytical thinking, and multi-tasking abilities.

Why Apply -

Atos internships provide students with a rewarding opportunity to develop technical and leadership skills outside of the classroom. Whether you’re working towards your degree, or you’ve already graduated, your journey is just beginning. We’ll be with you all the way, developing your potential and powering your progress.

Here at Atos, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated, and free to be who they are at work. Our employee lifecycle processes are designed to prevent discrimination against our people regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes them unique. Across the globe, we have created a variety of programs to embed our Atos culture of inclusivity, and work hard to ensure that all of our employees have an equal opportunity to contribute and feel that they are exactly where they belong.

At HPE, we bring together the brightest minds to create breakthrough technology solutions and advance the way people live and work. Our legacy inspires us as we forge ahead dedicated to helping our customers make their mark on the world.

Learning does not only happen through training. Relationships are among the most powerful ways for people to learn and grow, and this is part of our HPE culture. In addition to working alongside talented colleagues, you will have many opportunities to learn through coaching and stretch assignment opportunities. You’ll be guided by feedback and support to accelerate your learning and maximize your knowledge. We also have a “reverse mentoring” program which allows us to share our knowledge and strengths across our multi-generation workforce.

position: Computer Vision and Machine Learning Intern
description:
About Us

Iron Ox is reimagining the modern farm, utilizing robotics and AI to grow fresh, consistent, and responsibly farmed produce for everyone. Our experienced team of growers, plant scientists, engineers, and innovators are passionate about deeply understanding and developing this new wave of technology to feed an ever-growing population.

Our mission at Iron Ox is dedicated to addressing some of the most significant issues in food security, now and in the future. We’re focused on sustainable, scalable food production for a changing climate and an ever-growing population.

As a Computer Vision and Machine Learning Software Engineering intern you will join the Software team to help realize our vision for an optimized, intelligent farm. As an intern, you will be paired with a mentor who will guide you through implementing a prototype system to address a challenge facing our robotic farm. Some examples of projects you may work on include: counting and classifying insects in our farm, inspecting and classifying unhealthy leaves on our plants or building a multi-sensor calibration system for our robots.

This internship is a great opportunity to get hands-on experience while learning from a diverse group of professionals. This is a great way to learn more about robotics and farming as well.

What You'll Do

  • Design a computer vision and/or machine learning solution to address a real business problem
  • Implement your solution in Python and test your software on real data, then integrate your solution into a production facility
  • Drive the project direction and design with mentor guidance
  • Receive feedback from your mentor and other software engineers as well as hardware engineers and plant scientists to help improve your solution

What You'll Bring

  • Graduate student with a CS degree or advanced undergraduate student with a focus on computer vision and/or machine learning
  • Past projects in CV/ML or advanced coursework
  • Comfortable working in Python and at least one deep learning framework such as PyTorch or Tensorflow
  • Able to communicate clearly and effectively

Nice-to-Haves

  • Interest in agriculture, hydroponics, and/or plant biology

What We Offer

  • Paid Internship
  • Iron Ox is a small startup with a big dream. You’ll be a part of a team founded on transparency, creativity, and impact on our mission to feed people
  • We’re a tight-knit group that likes to work hard while also having fun
We are a mission-driven and well-funded startup, backed by the likes of YCombinator, Pathbreaker Ventures, and Crosslink Capital. We are headquartered in San Carlos, CA with our primary production greenhouse facility located in Gilroy, CA.

Iron Ox is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Please note: Iron Ox does not accept unsolicited resumes from staffing vendors, including recruitment agencies and/or search firms. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Iron Ox employees, or any other company location. Any submittals without a prior signed agreement will become property of Iron Ox.

The Company

Dyno Therapeutics is reshaping the gene therapy landscape through AI-powered vectors. Through the application of our transformative technologies and strategic partnerships with leaders in gene therapy, we believe a future with life changing gene therapies for millions of people is within reach.

Our team includes world-class molecular and synthetic biologists, protein engineers and gene therapy scientists working alongside software engineers, data scientists, and machine learning experts. Dyno was named Xconomy's 2020 start up of the year!

The Role

Software Engineering Intern - Summer 2021. The software engineering team is at the heart of Dyno's platform, and your work as a part of this team can have a major impact on the future of gene therapy. Our team's responsibilities include automating computational and machine learning workflows, optimizing cutting edge cloud infrastructure and compute clusters, scaling databases and data processing algorithms, and controlling laboratory equipment and scientific processes. Our team is looking for candidates with a diverse set of skills and experience and a passion for working autonomously and learning things on the fly.

How You Will Contribute

As a Software Engineering Intern, depending on your background, you will participate in developing cloud native applications for automating complex scientific and ML workflows, scaling of our data architecture, building interfaces between teams and technologies, and contributing to the vision of the data science team.

Who you are

  • Trusted partner
  • Team oriented
  • Thoughtful & detail oriented
  • Work with a sense of urgency
  • Appreciate the opportunities at the intersections of software engineering, data science and biology

Basic qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in or recently completed a Computer Science or similar BS or MS program
  • Experience in Python and relational databases
  • Internship or work experience in an industrial or academic research setting
  • Passion for solving problems

Preferred qualifications

  • Experience with Kubernetes and cloud infrastructure
  • Experience working with biological data, especially NGS data.
  • Proficiency with data warehousing concepts, data architectures, infrastructure components, and environments (e.g. AWS/GCP, Postgres/mysql, docker, Jupyter notebooks).
  • A strong understanding of data structures and algorithm design.
  • Familiarity with any of the following: molecular biology, protein engineering, gene therapy, immunology, or virology.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Job Type: Internship

At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.

We are seeking a highly talented and motivated student for a summer internship in Late Stage Immuno-Oncology. This internship position will focus on assessing the effects of genetic alterations and expressions on response to immunotherapy.

The successful candidate will have the opportunity to independently conduct a computational research project using clinical datasets to support the immune-oncology programs. The candidate will work closely with experienced bioinformatics scientists and cross-functional teams.

Bristol-Myers Squibb is an industry leader in immuno-oncology pipelines with rich clinical portfolios covering many cancer indications. Our mission is to discover, develop and deliver innovative medicines that help patients prevail over serious diseases.

Key Responsibilities

  • Perform analysis of clinical and biomarker datasets (e.g., large-scale omics datasets including RNA-seq, exome and whole genome sequencing)
  • Integrate real-world clinical and molecular datasets to answer key scientific questions
  • Perform analysis and visualization in a reproducible research framework
  • Deliver results and present findings for decision-makings

Qualifications & Experience

  • Master or PhD student enrolled in bioinformatics, statistics, computer science or related fields
  • Must be able to work full-time for at least 10 weeks
  • Demonstrated hands-on experience in one of the following programming languages: R, Python, Perl
  • Experience working with genomics and next-generation sequencing data (RNA-seq, WES, WGS) is required; experience in clinical trial data analysis is a plus
  • Domain knowledge in molecular biology and statistics is highly preferred
  • Independent, creative thinking and strong problem-solving skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

position: MDP Data Science Engineer Intern Job
description:
BJ's Wholesale Club was the first retailer to introduce the warehouse club concept in the northeastern United States. Today, we’re a multibillion dollar operation with more than 200 clubs in 17 states from Maine to Florida.

While our Members know us for helping them save up to 25% off grocery prices every day, our Team Members love us for providing a supportive and engaging workplace that’s committed to developing great talent.

If you’re a motivated and enthusiastic person who enjoys working collaboratively and is committed to providing great service for our Members, we want to hear from you. BJ’s offers a fast-paced, team environment with great training opportunities and competitive salary and benefits packages to help you succeed.

At BJs Wholesale Club, we offer a 12-week summer internship experience through our Management Development Program. The MDP internship offers competitive pay and is built on three tenants: day-to-day exposure to a specific team, a strategic business solution project presented to our executive team, and personal and professional development through various development workshops and team building activities. As an intern you will work with your manager as well as many other leaders in the department and assigned a mentor that will help you navigate day to day operations. Throughout the program you will gain entry level role experience, visibility to our executives through IKE sessions as well as coffee with our CEO and work directly on business critical issues. After successful completion of the program, you will have the opportunity to transition into a permanent role.

Responsibilities:

  • Extract actionable insights from complex datasets using data mining, statistics, and database techniques to measure/understand/improve member acquisition/engagement KPIs

  • Apply Data Science methods along with project management skills to assist in developing new approaches to member acquisition, engagement and promotion

  • Work cross functionally with stakeholders to ensure data-driven answers are provided and recommended

  • Build reports, dashboards, and other analytical tools to help communicate the state of business

  • Works with and streamlines established data warehouses, production data, and available tools to build strategic datasets in support of key initiatives

  • Establishes and systematically performs processes to assess and validate data accuracy

Requirements:

  • GPA of 3.4 or above
  • Preferred major: Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a STEM related field
  • Graduation year: Graduate Student
  • competencies and experience designated by the business.
  • Leadership experience in programs, projects, clubs-preferred
  • Working knowledge on machine learning and statistical methods (Supervised/unsupervised learning, Linear/logistic Regression, Random Forests, Lift Modeling, Linear/nonlinear Programming, Clustering, ARIMA, Neural Networks, Variable selection/feature engineering, hypothesis testing
  • Experience with data ETL in at least one of the following scripting language: Python/R/SAS/SQL
  • Experience with Cloud computing environment preferred (AWS/Azure/Google Cloud)
  • Strong analytics background with the ability to apply analytical skills to business problems

BJ's Wholesale Club is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity for all qualified team members and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, ancestry, national origin, physical and/or mental disability, genetic information, atypical cellular or blood trait, marital and/or familial status, pregnancy, gender identity and expression, military or veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law.

position: Finance and Employee Experience Intern (Summer 2021) - San Mateo, CA
description:
Want to Work for a Different Type of Software Company? Join the Guidewire team!

At Guidewire, we pride ourselves on our inclusive and collaborative company culture. As part of our intern program, our experienced BizTech team will train and mentor you as you engage in meaningful work on our industry leading software products.

This role will provide key support to the Oracle Fusion Finance (ERP) team. Candidate will be involved in system configuration, supporting applications development, setups, process design. We are looking for someone who is a proactive quick learner with both independent tendencies and interdependent awareness. This person will be a team-player, and love solving new challenges every day.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Assist in working on live Oracle Fusion ERP projects such as:
  • Confige Financial applications like Oracle ERP, Coupa, Concur.
  • Contribute in Sprint Planning, Daily Scrums and work with business users and application team to achieve sprint goals.
  • Automate testing oracle processes.
  • Other ad-hoc tasks related to our G&A Applications team’s needs.

Your Skills and Experience

  • Currently enrolled in a BS or MS program in Computer Science, Computer Engineer, or Software Engineering, with an expected graduation date of Spring 2022.
  • Experience in some scripting language experience.
  • Zest to learn and ramp up on new technologies.
  • Ability to rapidly absorb new technologies and have the desire to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Collaborative work ethic and a team-player at heart.
  • Demonstrated problem solving skills.
  • Agile, systematic problem-solving approach, coupled with strong interpersonal skills and a sense of ownership and drive.

What to Expect

  • Deepen understanding of Financials processes like "Procure to Pay" and "Order to Cash".
  • Exposure to Oracle Fusion financial reporting OTBI/FRS/BI.
  • Functional experience with Design, Development, Implementation, Customization and Production Support of Oracle Fusion financials.
  • Develop proficiency in commonly used applications such as Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
  • Opportunities to collaborate and work closely with Engineers and Business Analysts as well as with the wider Business Technology team.
We live by our core values every day - COLLEGIALITY, INTEGRITY, RATIONALITY.

Collegiality - We value strong teams. We work together as professional equals. We strive to continuously improve our processes and make realistic assumptions to maintain a reasonable work-life balance. We are trusted to manage our own time. We value ideas, not titles. We happily welcome and consider contrary opinions.

Integrity - We insist on candid relationships with customers, prospective customers, partners, investors, and each other in everything that we do.

Rationality - We communicate through clear arguments. We decide carefully based on factual evidence. We like calm, systematic, thoughtful solutions. We believe in testing. We never take the assumption that we are building software the "best" way, and continuously seek to improve our processes.

About Guidewire
Guidewire is the platform P&C insurers trust to engage, innovate, and grow efficiently.

Guidewire combines core, data, digital, analytics, and AI to deliver our platform as a cloud service. More than 400 insurers, including the largest and most complex in the world, run on Guidewire.

As a partner to our customers, we continually evolve to enable their success. We are proud of our unparalleled implementation track record with 1000+ successful projects, supported by the largest R&D team and partner ecosystem in the industry. Our Marketplace provides hundreds of add-ons that accelerate integration, localization, and innovation.

Guidewire Software, Inc. is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We are committed to an inclusive workplace, and believe that a diversity of perspectives, abilities, and cultures is a key to our success. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship, marital status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability. All offers are contingent upon passing a criminal history and other background checks where it's applicable to the position.

Disability Accommodations and Guidewire’s Appeals Process. Guidewire provides accommodations to the hiring process to create a fair opportunity for candidates with disabilities to contend for open positions. Accommodation requests should be directed to (650) 356-4940 or Accommodations@guidewire.com. If things do not go as hoped, we invite you to use our appeals process. Guidewire promises to independently review any denied accommodation and any decision not to offer you the position. The appeals process is the same in either case. Within five business days of receiving a notice of denial of an accommodation, or receiving a notice of your non-selection for a vacancy, call (650) 356-4940 or e-mail Accommodations@guidewire.com to make an appeal. Guidewire will assign a new decision-maker to review the request and/or hiring decision, who will then notify you in writing of a decision within 10 business days.

Frequently cited statistics show that women and underrepresented groups apply to jobs only if they think they meet 100% of the qualifications on a job description. IMO wants you to apply, even if you don’t think you meet 100% of the qualifications listed. We look forward to receiving your application!

Work that is meaningful. A job that has impact. Colleagues that inspire. That’s what you’ll find at Intelligent Medical Objects (IMO), a growing health IT company creating clinical terminology and insights solutions that are used by more than 500,000 US physicians and 4,500 US hospitals to power better patient care and support meaningful analytics.

At IMO, a core team of clinicians, software developers, and data scientists combine computer science and medical expertise to help patients and healthcare professionals access high quality health information quickly and easily to improve total patient health. We are currently in need of Software Engineering Interns to join our team!

Gain experience writing, clean, quality, and testable code in a fast-paced collaborative environment. Contribute to innovative approaches to complex problems. Work and learn in a small cross functional agile team. Lead and participate in design and architecture decisions. Be passionate and continue to hone your craft in real world scenarios.

Join our growing Software Engineering department as a Software Engineering Intern to help design, create, and support high quality solutions that support 80% of US clinicians!

What You'll Do:

  • Deliver quality code via unit and integration testing through a suite of automated tests
  • Perform basic source code management tasks at the direction of more senior software engineers
  • Work with the team who are responsible for coding, validating, debugging, reliability, performance analysis and the ongoing operational aspects of the product in an Agile environment
  • Troubleshoot and resolves low to moderate complexity software bugs or issues, with close direction from more senior software engineers, and finds the root cause
  • Write automated unit and integration-level tests with direction from other team members
  • Follow development standards and effectively demonstrates technical solutions to other software engineers in code reviews
  • Coordinate with all cross functional team members to analyze issues
  • Document unit test procedures and participate in software development process to perform all tests on designs and ensure compliance with development standards
  • Work cooperatively with team members to manage conflict constructively and foster trust, commitment, accountability.
  • Deliver quality product leveraging the values of transparency, inspection and adaptation
  • Take ownership to proactively anticipate the implications and consequences of situations
  • Implement creative solutions to technical challenges and embraces out-of-the-box thinking

What You'll Need:

  • Diverse Sophomore or Junior level classroom experience and a passion within the field of Math, Statistics, Informatics, Information Sciences, Engineering, Computer Science or related.
  • Curiosity for technical challenges and an eagerness to explore new approaches.
  • Familiarity with software development and the willingness and capacity to learn
  • Familiarity with at least one of the following programming languages: C#, JavaScript, Angular 2 or 4, Typescript, ASP.NET, Java, C++, Python
  • Familiarity with modern JavaScript frameworks such as React or others
  • Familiarity working with cloud technologies (AWS preferred)
  • Awareness of software construction and principles
  • Ability to follow good development practices like test automation, CI/CD, source version control, etc.
  • Your voice (whether it’s a loud one or a quiet one). We believe in communicating. Ideas, needs, questions, concerns, good jokes.. Remember when we said we welcome your point of view? We meant it.
  • An autonomous attitude. Of course, we’re here to teach, support and guide you through the internship, but ultimately, you will own projects and your development.

What We'll Give You:

  • Training from the best. Collectively, we’ve got years of expertise in Healthcare and IT.
  • Extensive team-specific training that will drive your trajectory (classroom & beyond)
  • Coaching on the non-technical stuff like presentation skills, business etiquette, résumé workshop, etc.
  • A challenge. We’re here to push you. Our goal is to fill your summer with experience and connections you won’t forget. Probably a little fun, too.
  • The opportunity to directly influence our products.

What We Do

Bandwidth lives for innovation! Our technology powers brands like Google, Microsoft, GoDaddy, Arlo, Netgear, Zoom, Rover and more of the most exciting leaders in technology. Our intelligent voice, messaging, 9-1-1 access, and phone number services— all backed by Bandwidth's own nationwide, all-IP voice network—allow us to power the way people communicate, connect, and do business.

At Bandwidth, your music matters when you are part of the BAND. We celebrate differences and encourage BANDmates to be their authentic selves. #jointheband

What We Need

As the IP Network Engineering Intern with Bandwidth you can expect to be involved in the day-to-day operations of a highly resilient global network. You will be exposed to technologies from multiple vendors including, but not limited to, Cisco, Juniper and Palo Alto. You will learn how multiple pieces of network infrastructure interact seamlessly to provide Bandwidth's customers unparalleled voice quality.

What You'll Do:

  • Support the evaluation, development, and testing of tools to enhance Bandwidth's global IP Network
  • Participate in development of our network automation platform
  • Work closely with our network engineering team to research and provide recommendations for both datacenter and wan network architectures
  • Troubleshoot switching, routing, and firewalls, including troubleshooting of network device configuration and application interaction

What You'll Need:

  • Working towards a Bachelors or Masters degree in computer science, computer engineering or network related degree program
  • 0-3 years of experience with IP networking fundamentals and the application of IP protocols
  • Experience with deploying software in Docker
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • The ability to function independently on tasks and project work
  • Good Linux skills. Experience in Python and Django is a plus
  • Certifications are nice, but not required

A Little Extra For You

At Bandwidth, we're pretty proud of our corporate culture, which is rooted in our "Whole Person Promise." We promise all employees that they can have meaningful work AND a full life, and we provide a work environment geared toward enriching your body, mind, and spirit. How do we do that? Well…

  • You're guaranteed to be given "work that matters." If you ain't feelin' that, let us know. We'll fix it.
  • As a member of our intern program, you'll obviously gain some great professional experience. You'll also be part of our intern community, collaborating with other interns from across the company on service projects, fun outings, and training designed to educate you on Bandwidth's business.
  • We provide you with a gym membership, a lunchtime shuttle to the gym, and give you 90 minutes for lunch if you work out.
  • Not enough time to hit the gym? There's a locker room and cardio equipment on the second floor.

Applicant Privacy Notice

Who are you? You’re the best in your class. Not only in brain power, but in ideas, drive and gumption. You have an unyielding interest in the digital marketing world, and you can’t wait to dive in.

Our program abandons the notion of a mainstream internship, venturing beyond basic “digital marketing exposure.” As a Three Ships intern, you will work with the Three Ships team, not for the team. We give you both opportunity and responsibility. The freedom to experiment. To whet your appetite in the world of digital marketing.

Below is a list of available internships. Whether you want to pursue a path to become a great writer/editor, or grow in the world of digital marketing analytics in either the SEO or Paid Media fields, we have the opportunity that you are looking for here!

Marketing Analyst Intern

The Marketing Analyst Intern will:

  • Work with the Director of SEO on data analyses, including but not limited to: 1) sizing new opportunities, 2) identifying areas for further growth/optimization within existing programs
  • Compile and maintain data related to revenue conversion and organic search performance
  • Research and analyze competitors and the SEO landscape in selected industries
  • Assemble and present project plans and/or client-facing documents based on final analysis
  • Support Director in other miscellaneous tasks as needed

Top three traits we’re looking for:

  • Demonstrated track record of entrepreneurship / ownership / a real “go getter”
  • Sharp analytics
  • Great attention to detail

SEO Intern - 3S Auto

A Search Engine Optimization (SEO) intern for the 3S Auto team will be assisting with growing organic traffic across our existing portfolio of automotive web content. Prior experience in SEO and the automotive industry is not a requirement, though previous background or classes in marketing, computer science, and/or writing are good foundations for this role. Some of the responsibilities for this position will include:

The SEO Intern will:

  • Implement optimizations to page titles, meta descriptions, and other key technical components on target pages
  • Implement changes to the copy and structure of existing content with the goal of improving rankings and better serving the intent of searchers
  • Record traffic and keyword rank trends by monitoring, maintaining, and improving existing tracking dashboards
  • Review keyword research to identify new content opportunities
  • Update broken links, widgets, images, etc. across the content as needed
  • Learn about SEO best practices through webinars, online training courses, and industry case studies, as well as sharing relevant learnings with the rest of the Auto team

Content Intern - 3S Auto

The Content Intern will:

  • Be responsible for writing informative, well-researched, and entertaining articles that will engage our audience
  • Learn how to have your pieces rank well in Google by implementing SEO and CRO best practices
  • Upload articles to our partner sites and optimize published articles to improve rankings
  • Participate in creative and analytic strategy sessions
  • Learn from a leadership team with a deep understanding of the digital media landscape

Content Intern - EcoWatch.com

EcoWatch.com seeks a Content Intern to help produce industry-defining copy on sustainable living, environmental solutions, and innovations in the green space. A background in journalism or writing is preferred, as this candidate will have the opportunity to reach millions of readers each month with informative, entertaining articles on one of the most pressing issues of our time. It’s a great portfolio builder for anyone interested in SEO, digital marketing, or online journalism.

The Content Intern will:

  • Write 5-10 eco-focused brand reviews and round-ups each week
  • Focus on identifying eco-friendly products in priority Amazon categories
  • Write effective, clean copy that connects to our review standards and brand mission
  • Work alongside Senior Editors, getting direct feedback and editing experience
  • Have the opportunity to write relevant news stories for our audience of 3M monthly users

Paid Media Intern (x2) - 3S Home

Looking for an opportunity to get fully immersed in the world of paid media? Join our fast growing team and get hands on experience in driving paid media performance across a multitude of platforms like Google Ads, Google Analytics, Bing Ads and more. You will learn how to analyze key performance metrics and will help execute account optimizations to drive profitable conversion growth. You will get the opportunity to dive deep into the weeds of mature paid search accounts by conducting keyword analysis, modifying bid strategies, creating ad copy, and optimizing landing pages. The outputs of those efforts will be used to make proactive, data-driven decisions to continue to drive our business forward.

The Paid Media Intern will:

  • Measure and report on paid media performance metrics to assist with making data-driven decisions to drive profitable conversion growth.
  • Assist with keyword analysis, ad creation, landing page optimization, and bid strategy execution to drive profitable expansion of our paid media accounts.
  • Provide in-depth competitive analyses and market research to help drive ad testing, conversion rate optimization and campaign strategy.
  • Continually monitor brand positioning and track down brand nuance as necessary.
  • Use statistical analysis to draw conclusions about marketing campaigns and make recommendations accordingly.
  • Assist with regular maintenance tasks such as search query analysis, promotional updates, data uploads, quality score analysis, etc.

Digital Marketing Intern - 3S Home

Do you love digital content, always staying current on the latest trends in blogs, social media and the Internet? Do you want to learn more about everything digital marketing has to offer? 3S Home is looking for an intern who is looking for experience working in multiple areas of digital marketing such as SEO, content writing and editing, digital PR, and data analysis.

The Digital Marketing Intern will:

  • Assist in analyzing our SEO performance to identify new opportunities for organic growth and optimization.
  • Ideate, create, and pitch digital PR campaigns to earn coverage from top-tier home and lifestyle publications.
  • Write content that not only engages the user but wins in organic search as well.
  • Edit content, working with freelance writers to ensure quality.
  • Collect and analyze large datasets.

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply through LinkedIn using this link: https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/2425102109/. Attach a resume, cover letter and a 2-3 minute video explaining who you are, what position you are interested in and why you want to work at Three Ships (LinkedIn will provide directions as you go through the application process). Internship submissions will be accepted through February 26th. If selected for an interview, you will be contacted between March 1st-March 3rd for an intern interview day on Friday, March 5th.

Our clients are middle-market companies competing in the global marketplace. We have always been about “doing more.” The “&” in our company name symbolizes our desire to bring something extra, unexpected and invaluable to the table. It means our clients will always get something more. We don’t consider our service approach as going the extra mile. Here, at Clayton & McKervey, it’s expected and routine.

We’re proud of our Michigan roots, but consider the entire world our workplace. Our clients are middle-market companies competing in the global marketplace. They’re headquartered here in the U.S. and abroad. At Clayton & McKervey we think and act like entrepreneurs; speaking the same language as our entrepreneurial clients.

(MTSI) is co-owned by more than 1,300 engineers, analysts, and professionals dedicated to providing high caliber services to aerospace and defense and intelligence customers across the US. position: Intern, Product Management and Analysis S/4 Cross Engineering
description:
Requisition ID: 279303
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern


COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS

Our team wants to change the way enterprise software is built. The Product Management and Analysis intern will be contributing to special pilot and incubation projects while focusing on providing data insight.

As a PM&A intern, you will work on a specific project critical to SAP S/4's needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our PM&A intern to be an advocate for the product. In addition to being customer-centric, they must be versatile, curious, have a highly analytical mind, display leadership qualities, and be enthusiastic to take on new problems as we continue to push the product forward.

The PM&A intern is responsible for assisting internal teams by any means for the success of a product.

Overall duties include, but are not limited to:

  • Analyze technology trends and customer requirements to identify growth opportunities for SAP and drive innovation.
  • Support internal teams with data-driven analysis to drive key business initiatives and decisions.
  • Work closely with customers to understand the context, business needs, and gather data to facilitate the development of solutions.
  • Retrieve, manipulate and analyze data from various sources to draw relevant and actionable conclusions.
  • Contribute to proof-of-concept and prototyping efforts with our team of engineers.
  • Support the development, testing, and maintenance of applications/features.
  • Contribute to the business case, develop and drive a product vision, strategy, and a product roadmap.
  • Ensures that both the internal stakeholders & external ecosystem have a flawless understanding of the product vision and are aware of the developments.
  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.
  • Hire and onboard top talent and contribute to our healthy and flourishing team culture.

WORK EXPERIENCE

  • BS degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Hands-on mentality and an unremitting focus on getting the right things done.
  • Very strong problem-solving and analytical skills, including the ability to rapidly gather data, structure hypotheses, and develop synthesized findings/recommendations.
  • Passion for business problems and finding solutions to solve them.
  • Experience developing web-based applications.
  • Interest and ability to learn new skills as needed.
  • Prior experience with SCRUM/Agile methodologies.
  • Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English.
  • Team player with the ability to thrive on virtual, international, cross-functional teams.
  • Strong presentation skills.
  • International experience – working and/or studying in several countries – a plus.
  • Knowledge of wholesale distribution, consumer products, or retail is a plus.

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

In this role, you have the opportunity to

Develop automation for and test cutting edge embedded processor systems.

You are responsible for

  • Reviewing existing automation scripts and executing scripts on a target system
  • Updating and enhancing existing scripts
  • Manually executing test cases
  • Assisting with lab management, updating equipment database
You are a part of

A highly technical and collaborative software quality assurance team that verifies the quality of product software and ensures it meets our customer's expectations.

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Completed sophomore or junior year toward a BS degree in a computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering or related field
  • Experience with at least one of the following programming / scripting languages: C, C++, Python, Ruby, bash
  • Familiarity with the following operating systems: Windows, Linux
  • Hands-on experience with electronics equipment
  • Organized and detail-oriented
  • Collaborative development with version control tools such as Git is a plus
Why should you join Mercury Systems?

Mercury Systems is the leader in making trusted, secure mission-critical technologies profoundly more accessible to the aerospace and defense industries. Optimized for customer and mission success, our innovative solutions power more than 300 critical aerospace and defense programs. Headquartered in Andover, Mass., and with manufacturing and design facilities around the world, Mercury specializes in engineering, adapting and manufacturing new solutions purpose-built to meet the industry's current and emerging high-tech needs. Our employees are committed to Innovation that Matters®.

Our Culture

We are committed to making Mercury a great place to work, no matter where our employees are located. We offer a casual and enjoyable atmosphere that allows employees to learn and grow. We help and care for one another and work as one to achieve results for us and for our customers. We value communication and transparency, and strive to foster two-way dialogue at all levels of the organization. We are committed to lifelong learning, offering comprehensive skills training and tuition reimbursement. Whether you're just starting out on your career journey or you are an experienced professional, it's important to us that you feel recognized and rewarded for your contributions.

To find out more about Why Mercury?, or visit the Mercury Community or find answers to general questions at Mercury FAQs

Mercury Systems is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, creed, citizenship, disability, protected veteran or marital status.

As an equal opportunity employer, Mercury Systems is committed to a diverse workforce. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veterans' Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990. The successful Software Engineering Intern at Noregon works with a team to develop, design and implement the complete life cycle of new and modified software products used by our customers.

Department: Engineering

  • Participate in requirements, design, code and test plan reviews
